htLib.lib module

class htLib.lib.BSerial(**kwargs)

Bases: serial.serialwin32.Serial

Class makes the connection, sends data and receives data from serial port.

Parameters

Serial (Serial) – inherits from Serial class

__init__(**kwargs)

constructor of Serial. see more information: init from Serial.

Parameters

**kwargs (see in https://pyserial.readthedocs.io/en/latest/pyserial_api.html.) – like in init Serial in pyserial.

write_string_port(value)

write string in serial port.

Parameters

value (type) – send value to serial port. It will be converted to string, you have to control it.

start_read_string_port(command: function, separator='-')

initialize reading on serial port

Parameters

  • command (function) – it will receive as parameter a value from serial port. if they are several values, you have to make sure that they are sent separated by a “-“.

  • separator (str, optional) – separator of values], defaults to “-”

stop_read_string_port()

method to stop receiving values

class htLib.lib.Ubidot_Client(token, device)

Bases: object

This class offers connections to Ubidots platform. Now only can values to one device.

__init__(token, device)

init

Parameters

  • token (str) – toke of your ubidots account

  • device (str) – name of your ubidots device

send_value(variable_label, inthread=True, **data)

Send a value

Parameters

  • variable_label (str) – name of variable label in your ubidots device

  • inthread (bool, optional) – execute it in a thread, defaults to True

send_values(variable_label, inthread=True, *data)

send many values

Parameters

  • variable_label (str) – name of variable label in your ubidots device

  • inthread (bool, optional) – execute it in a thread, defaults to True

Raises

ValueError – all Elements in data must be a dictionary, pass of this way: value=27, value=24

close()

Close serial port connection

class htLib.lib.Email(email, password)

Bases: object

This class offers method to send a email of a easy mode

__init__(email, password)

init

Parameters

  • email (str) – user email.

  • password (str) – user password.

send_email(dest, message='email from python', server='smtp.live.com', port=587)

Send a email. defaults It works with gmail

Parameters

  • dest (str) – Destination email.

  • message (str, optional) – messsage to send, defaults to “email from python”

  • server (str, optional) – server email, defaults to “smtp.live.com”

  • port (int, optional) – port email, defaults to 587
